Description: Neck and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery olpe; exterior: on neck, part of incised spoked rosette with added red; below, dilute line; below, black-figure decoration consisting of neck and part of lion's head to right (red mane and added white on teeth); incised spoked rosette with red centre and alternating petals, ring of coalescing dots and blob rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Gorgon Painter ((manner of or by))
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 300-1, no. B295)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 224, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0293) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 92, pl. I, no. 28)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
